data.chText: 树篱
data.enText: a row of bushes or small trees planted close together, usually along the edge of a field, garden/yard or road

data.chText: 女贞树篱
data.enText: a privet hedge

data.chText: 防止损失（尤指金钱）的手段
data.enText: a way of protecting yourself against the loss of sth, especially money

data.chText: 购买黄金以抵消通货膨胀造成的损失
data.enText: to buy gold as a hedge against inflation

data.chText: 避免正面回答；不直接许诺；拐弯抹角
data.enText: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question or promising to support a particular idea, etc.

data.chText: 就回答“是”或“否”——别再闪烁其词了。
data.enText: Just answer ‘yes’ or ‘no’─and stop hedging.

data.chText: 在（田地等周围）植树篱；用树篱围住
data.enText: to put a hedge around a field, etc.

data.chText: 包围；限制
data.enText: to surround or limit sb/sth

data.chText: 他的宗教信仰一直受到心不诚的局限。
data.enText: His religious belief was always hedged with doubt.

data.chText: 他们的建议附带了各种各样的限制条件。
data.enText: Their offer was hedged around with all sorts of conditions.
hedge your bets

data.chText: （为防止损失或出错）几面下注，有几项选择可选取
data.enText: to reduce the risk of losing or making a mistake by supporting more than one side in a competition, an argument, etc., or by having several choices available to you
hedge against sth

data.chText: 采取保护措施（尤指为避免损失金钱）
data.enText: to do sth to protect yourself against problems, especially against losing money

data.chText: 避免货币风险的保值措施
data.enText: a way of hedging against currency risks
hedge sb/sth↔in

data.chText: 包围；环绕
data.enText: to surround sb/sth with sth

data.chText: 大教堂现在被其他建筑物包围着。
data.enText: The cathedral is now hedged in by other buildings.

data.chText: 婚姻生活使他感觉受到束缚而且心烦。
data.enText: Married life made him feel hedged in and restless.

means: 防止损失(尤指金钱)的手段

ex.enText: They climbed over the wall into the orchard.

ex.chText: 那幢建筑物除了墙以外都烧光了。
ex.enText: The building was burnt out and only the walls remained.
The wall cuts across our line of vision.

synonyms.bx: 指为了分隔、围绕或防卫某一区域而用石头、砖头等建起的院墙或城墙。

ex.chText: 我们发现整个围栏都粉刷好了。
ex.enText: We found the entire fence whitewashed.

ex.chText: 他们在四周修起一圈栅栏防止儿童掉进去。
ex.enText: They built a fence all around to stop children (from) falling in.

ex.chText: 花园的围栏上爬满了相互缠绕的牵牛花。
ex.enText: The fence in the garden is covered with intertwining morning glory.

synonyms.bx: 通常指用木头、铁丝等做成的隔栏，把地块、房院等与外界隔离开。

ex.chText: 他想把树篱剪低些，但邻居不同意。
ex.enText: He wanted to cut down the hedge, but his neighbour objected.

ex.chText: 春天到了，树篱长出了新叶子。
ex.enText: Spring has come and the hedges are putting forth new leaves.

ex.chText: 草坪四周的矮树篱阻止人们踏上草地。
ex.enText: Low hedges round lawns stop people from walking on the grass.

synonyms.bx: 通常用低矮的灌木或树构成，用于分隔地块、园子等。

ex.chText: 他们想用铁丝网把花园围起来。
ex.enText: They wanted to use the wire netting to surround the garden.

ex.chText: 士兵们悄悄地从敌人的铁丝网下钻了过去。
ex.enText: The soldiers quietly went under the enemy's wire netting.

ex.chText: 一只鸟被金属丝网缠住了。
ex.enText: A bird got entangled in the wire netting.

synonyms.bx: 尤用于修建围栏，与美国英语的 wire mesh 同义。

data.enText: hedge your bets

data.chText: （为防止损失或出错）几面下注，有几项选择可选取
data.enText: to reduce the risk of losing or making a mistake by supporting more than one side in a competition, an argument, etc., or by having several choices available to you
hedge against sth

data.chText: 采取保护措施（尤指为避免损失金钱）
data.enText: to do sth to protect yourself against problems, especially against losing money

data.chText: 避免货币风险的保值措施
data.enText: a way of hedging against currency risks
hedge sb/sth↔in

data.chText: 包围；环绕
data.enText: to surround sb/sth with sth

data.chText: 大教堂现在被其他建筑物包围着。
data.enText: The cathedral is now hedged in by other buildings.

data.chText: 婚姻生活使他感觉受到束缚而且心烦。
data.enText: Married life made him feel hedged in and restless.

trans: （以各种规则或条件）束缚，限制

tr: a fence formed by a row of closely planted shrubs or bushes
an intentionally noncommittal or ambiguous statement
example: when you say `maybe' you are just hedging

tr: any technique designed to reduce or eliminate financial risk
for example, taking two positions that will offset each other if prices change

example: diversify your financial portfolio to hedge price risks

tr: avoid or try to avoid fulfilling, answering, or performing (duties, questions, or issues)
example: They tend to evade their responsibilities

tr: enclose or bound in with or as it with a hedge or hedges
hinder or restrict with or as if with a hedge

value.def: A hedge is a row of bushes or small trees, usually along the edge of a garden, field, or road.
If you hedge against something unpleasant or unwanted that might affect you, especially losing money, you do something which will protect you from it.

example.ex: You can hedge against redundancy or illness with insurance...
example.tran: 可以购买保险以防失业或患病。

example.ex: Today's clever financial instruments make it possible for firms to hedge their risks.
example.tran: 现今各种巧妙的金融手段使得各公司防范风险成为可能。

value.tran: 防备，防范（尤指金钱损失）

value.def: Something that is a hedge against something unpleasant will protect you from its effects.

example.ex: Gold is traditionally a hedge against inflation.
example.tran: 购买黄金是防范通货膨胀的一种传统手段。

value.tran: 防护物;防备手段;防范措施

value.def: If you hedge, you avoid answering a question or committing yourself to a particular action or decision.

example.ex: They hedged in answering various questions about the operation...
example.tran: 他们闪烁其词，不愿回答有关此次行动的各种问题。

example.ex: 'I can't give you an answer now,' he hedged.
example.tran: “我现在不能回答你，”他闪避道。

value.def: If you hedge your bets, you reduce the risk of losing a lot by supporting more than one person or thing in a situation where they are opposed to each other.

example.ex: Hawker Siddeley tried to hedge its bets by diversifying into other fields...
example.tran: 霍克·西德利试图通过在其他领域进行多样化发展来规避风险。

example.ex: Forecasters are hedging their bets about the outcome of this Saturday's Louisiana governor's race.
example.tran: 预测家对本周六路易斯安那州州长竞选的结果骑墙观望，多手下注。

value.tran: 两面下注以防损失;骑墙

trans: 两边下注；避免损失的措施
避免通货膨胀损失的套期保值
